guidelines:
(using GIBCO LM agarose = now called Invitrogen Life Technologies LMP agarose, 1-800-955-6288, cat# 1-5517-014 for 50 g, 1-5517-022 for 100 g)
Note: new catalog number is16520-050.

source_data.annotation: Some strains (MED4, NATL2A, WH 8102, WH 7803) can go without base plates but may not stay pigmented as long as those plates with base plates, whereas other strains may do better without base plates (SS120 and MIT 9312?)

source_data.annotation: I prepare cyanophage dilutions with media in 5 ml Falcon tubes to plate the cyanophage by simply adding 2.7 ml of the cell-agarose mixture to the cyanophage dilution that can be vortexed right in the tube and pour plated immediately.

components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use filtered, autoclaved 75% SSW to make up plates.

components.data: Top Agarose
components.name: Section

components.data: Add appropriate agarose (0.5 g / 100 ml SSW) and microwave as above
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add appropriate agarose (0.5 g / 100 ml SSW) and microwave as above

components.data: Top Agarose
components.name: Section

components.data: Allow to cool in a pre-heated water bath to ~29°C (solidifies ~24-28°C)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow to cool in a pre-heated water bath to ~29°C (solidifies ~24-28°C)

components.data: Top Agarose
components.name: Section

components.data: Asceptically add filter sterilized nutrients to bring level of top agarose nutrients to desired media of choice
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Asceptically add filter sterilized nutrients to bring level of top agarose nutrients to desired media of choice

components.data: Top Agarose
components.name: Section

components.data: Add appropriate volume of cells to top agarose, vortex to thoroughly mix and plate immediately
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add appropriate volume of cells to top agarose, vortex to thoroughly mix and plate immediately

components.data: Top Agarose
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of Plating Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains in top agarose for plaque assays
source_data.protocol_name: Plating Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains in top agarose for plaque assays
source_data.protocol_name_html: Plating Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains in top agarose for plaque assays
source_data.annotation: I add 10 ml of a dense stock of exponentially growing cells (~ 10^8 cells ml^-1) to 40 ml of top agarose in an orange capped 50 ml centrifuge tube.
source_data.thread_text: I add 10 ml of a dense stock of exponentially growing cells (~ 10^8 cells ml^-1) to 40 ml of top agarose in an orange capped 50 ml centrifuge tube.
source_data.body: I add 10 ml of a dense stock of exponentially growing cells (~ 10^8 cells ml^-1) to 40 ml of top agarose in an orange capped 50 ml centrifuge tube.

components.data: Inoculate a liquid culture using the same dilution chosen for the plates as an indicator of when the plates might turn green (within a few days of each other)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Inoculate a liquid culture using the same dilution chosen for the plates as an indicator of when the plates might turn green (within a few days of each other)

components.data: Incubate all plates overnight at ~2-5 uE light without parafilming the plates to allow the top agarose to solidify completely
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate all plates overnight at ~2-5 uE light without parafilming the plates to allow the top agarose to solidify completely

components.data: After the o/n incubation parafilm the plates (humidity control) and place at the appropriate light levels
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the o/n incubation parafilm the plates (humidity control) and place at the appropriate light levels

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 16 of Plating Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains in top agarose for plaque assays
source_data.protocol_name: Plating Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains in top agarose for plaque assays
source_data.protocol_name_html: Plating Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus strains in top agarose for plaque assays
source_data.annotation: Due to the harshness of the plating procedures, the light levels for plating might need be slightly reduced (~ to 33% less) to those used for liquid cultures. Also, marine cyanobacterial cells will not likely grow if there is any liquid in the agarose (we are plating at the limits of where this agarose can solidify, so if the humidity is wrong I may not get solid top agarose.
source_data.thread_text: Due to the harshness of the plating procedures, the light levels for plating might need be slightly reduced (~ to 33% less) to those used for liquid cultures. Also, marine cyanobacterial cells will not likely grow if there is any liquid in the agarose (we are plating at the limits of where this agarose can solidify, so if the humidity is wrong I may not get solid top agarose.
source_data.body: Due to the harshness of the plating procedures, the light levels for plating might need be slightly reduced (~ to 33% less) to those used for liquid cultures. Also, marine cyanobacterial cells will not likely grow if there is any liquid in the agarose (we are plating at the limits of where this agarose can solidify, so if the humidity is wrong I may not get solid top agarose.
